perturbation.original_text: 1.2 "Affiliate" with respect to the Village Media Company shall mean any of HOFV and any of the following entities so long as it is directly or indirectly controlled by, or is under common control, with HOFV: HOF Village Stadium, LLC; HOF Village Parking, LLC; HOF Village Land, LLC; HOF Village Youth Fields, LLC; HOF Village Hotel I, LLC; HOF Village Sports Business, LLC; Youth Sports Management, LLC; HOF Village Parking Management I, LLC; HOF Village Residences I, LLC; HOF Village Center for Excellence, LLC; HOF Village Center for Performance, LLC; HOF Experience, LLC; and JCIHOFV Financing, LLC. "Affiliate" with respect to PFHOF shall mean any entity that is directly or indirectly controlled by, or is under common control with, PFHOF. For purposes of this definition, "control" means an equity or income interest of fifty percent (50%) or more, or the possession of the power, directly or indirectly, to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of the Affiliate, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract, or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 "Affiliate" with respect to the Village Media Company shall mean any of HOFV and any of the following entities so long as it is related to HOFV: HOF Village Stadium, LLC; HOF Village Parking, LLC; HOF Village Land, LLC; HOF Village Youth Fields, LLC; HOF Village Hotel I, LLC; HOF Village Sports Business, LLC; Youth Sports Management, LLC; HOF Village Parking Management I, LLC; HOF Village Residences I, LLC; HOF Village Center for Excellence, LLC; HOF Village Center for Performance, LLC; HOF Experience, LLC; and JCIHOFV Financing, LLC. "Affiliate" with respect to PFHOF shall mean any entity that is associated with PFHOF. For purposes of this definition, "control" means an operational relationship.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Affiliate' and 'control' has been altered to introduce ambiguity. Originally, 'control' required a 50% equity or the power to direct management. The modified definition replaces it with 'operational relationship,' which is vague and lacks a clear legal standard. The definition of 'Affiliate' has been changed to be 'related to' and 'associated with', which introduces a level of uncertainty in determining which entities fall under the affiliate definition, thereby contradicting established legal interpretations of corporate control and affiliation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General corporate law principles regarding affiliate relationships and control.

perturbation.original_text: 2.3 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, PFHOF shall have the right to approve (in its sole and absolute discretion) any and all usage of, and Village Media Company's (and its Affiliates' and permitted licensees') plans to Exploit, the PFHOF Works (including any inclusion of any PFHOF Work in any HOFV Work and the term of such usage). Prior to any initial Exploitation of a PFHOF Work, the Village Media Company, at its own expense, must furnish to the Advisory Board and PFHOF a written notice ("Notice") which Notice will set forth the Village Media Company's proposal for Exploitation of a PFHOF Work (whether by itself or as incorporated into a HOFV Work), which proposal shall at a minimum specify the applicable PFHOF Work(s) to be Exploited by the Village Media Company, the nature and location of the proposed Exploitation and a pro forma specifying the economics and approximate time period related to such Exploitation. The Advisory Board shall, within fourteen (14) days of its receipt of the Notice, make a recommendation to PFHOF to either approve or reject such proposal as set forth in the Notice. PFHOF shall, within fourteen (14) days of its receipt of the recommendation of the Advisory Board, either approve or reject the proposal as set forth in the Notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.3 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, PFHOF shall have the right to suggest changes to Village Media Company's (and its Affiliates' and permitted licensees') plans to Exploit, the PFHOF Works (including any inclusion of any PFHOF Work in any HOFV Work and the term of such usage). Prior to any initial Exploitation of a PFHOF Work, the Village Media Company, at its own expense, must furnish to the Advisory Board and PFHOF a written notice ("Notice") which Notice will set forth the Village Media Company's proposal for Exploitation of a PFHOF Work (whether by itself or as incorporated into a HOFV Work), which proposal shall at a minimum specify the applicable PFHOF Work(s) to be Exploited by the Village Media Company, the nature and location of the proposed Exploitation. The Advisory Board shall make suggestions to PFHOF to possibly change such proposal as set forth in the Notice. PFHOF shall give recommendations that should be considered as set forth in the Notice.
perturbation.explanation: The term **'approve'** has been replaced by 'suggest changes' and 'give recommendations'. This subtly shifts the legal power from PFHOF having absolute discretion to merely providing suggestions. This creates uncertainty and contradicts the original intent by weakening PFHOF's control over the Exploitation of PFHOF Works and could lead to disputes regarding whether PFHOF's suggestions are binding or merely advisory.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding approval rights and discretionary authority.

perturbation.original_text: 6. FORCE MAJEURE In the event either Party is unable to comply fully with its obligations (other than payment obligations) under this Agreement due to an event beyond the control of the Party whose performance is affected, including any legal prohibition, court order, degree, regulation or requirement of any governmental entity having jurisdiction, strikes, catastrophe, drought, shortage of water or other action of the elements, temporary or permanent shutdown due to regulatory or other governmental actions, or Acts of God or any other matters beyond its control, such Party shall while so affected be relieved to the extent thus prevented from performing its obligations hereunder and such non-performance shall not, in and of itself, be deemed to be a breach of this Agreement; provided that, in such event, the non-performing Party takes all commercially reasonable measures to remove the disability and resume full performance hereunder at the earliest possible date.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. External Factors In the event either Party is unable to comply fully with its obligations (other than payment obligations) under this Agreement due to external matters to the Party whose performance is affected, including any suggestions of legal action, recommendations, changes in circumstance, minor incidents, or matters beyond its immediate control, such Party shall while so affected be relieved to the extent thus prevented from performing its obligations hereunder and such non-performance shall not, in and of itself, be deemed to be a breach of this Agreement; provided that, in such event, the non-performing Party attempts to mitigate the issue.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of **'Force Majeure'** has been replaced by 'External Factors'. Force Majeure traditionally encompasses events like natural disasters, legal prohibitions, and other unforeseeable catastrophes. The modified clause broadens the scope to include vague terms like 'suggestions of legal action,' 'minor incidents,' and 'changes in circumstance'. This undermines the established legal understanding of Force Majeure as applying only to extraordinary events beyond a party's control. This creates ambiguity and could lead to parties invoking the clause for trivial reasons, making the contract unenforceable under traditional Force Majeure principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law and statutory definitions of Force Majeure events.
